content.question: Which of the following best explains why both Nigeria and the United Kingdom have two major political parties?

choices.label: Both countries’ politics focus on economic issues, which leads to one party representing business interests while the other party represents labor interests.
Both countries’ electoral systems use single-member districts with first-past-the-post rules, which tend to favor catch-all parties.
Nigeria’s main cleavage is ethnic, while the United Kingdom’s main cleavage is regional, favoring two parties that represent those ethnic and regional cleavages.
Nigeria’s corrupt electoral authority suppresses small parties, while the United Kingdom’s use of proportional representation underrepresents small parties.

content.answer: Both countries’ electoral systems use single-member districts with first-past-the-post rules, which tend to favor catch-all parties.
